channel.title: Server Status Nulls
channel.description: I've been looking into why some nulls aren't replaced by users when they logged in. I found that when PHP uses sockets to check the server status, the server accepts the connection and then just waits. :eek: And that client number is filled with a Null that will never go away until the server is restarted. :| Anyone know how to tell if its a server status page so that the server can disconnect it and open the slot for a user? :D

item.title: Server Status Nulls
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

I’ve been looking into why some nulls aren’t replaced by users when they logged in. I found that when PHP uses sockets to check the server status, the server accepts the connection and then just waits. :eek: And that client number is filled with a Null that will never go away until the server is restarted. Anyone know how to tell if its a server status page so that the server can disconnect it and open the slot for a user?

Read full topic
